workflows.name: Solo Developer Flow
workflows.description: Ideal for students or freelancers. You commit directly to main, use branches for experiments, and merge after testing.

workflows.name: Small-Team Feature Branching
workflows.description: Each developer works on a dedicated branch. Merges are done via reviewed pull requests to maintain clean history.

workflows.name: Open-Source Contribution Flow
workflows.description: Contributors fork public repositories, create a branch for their change, and open a pull request for maintainers to review.

workflows.name: Company Gitflow Model
workflows.description: Used in medium-to-large organizations. Includes 'develop', 'release', and 'hotfix' branches for stable deployment pipelines.

workflows.name: Continuous Integration (CI/CD) Workflow
workflows.description: Every merge triggers automated builds, tests, and deployments ensuring code stays production-ready.

workflows.name: Documentation-First Workflow
workflows.description: Writers and developers collaborate through docs branches and PRs merging updates after technical reviews.
